question: Allan brought 6 balloons and Jake brought 2 balloons to the park. Jake then bought 3 more balloons at the park. How many more balloons did Allan have than Jake in the park?
response:
Allan brought 6 balloons and Jake brought 2 balloons, so Allan had 6 - 2 = <<6-2=4>>4 more balloons than Jake.
Jake then bought 3 more balloons at the park, so he now has 2 + 3 = <<2+3=5>>5 balloons.
Allan still has 4 balloons, so he has 4 - 5 = <<4-5=-1>>1 fewer balloons than Jake.
The answer is 1.
